titleStmt.title: (Copy of) list of priests and temple inventory
titleStmt.author: Orsenouphis

msContents.summary: The Soknobraisis priest Orsenouphis, in Bakchias, sends an official letter where he enumerates the priests of the temple as well as important objects belonging to the temple

msItem.note: 16 lines of cursive script along the fibres
Related to P. Fouad 186-189 (ed. A. Bataille, Un nouveau dieu Ä Bacchias, –tudes de papyrologie, 4, 1938, p. 197-205)

origin.origPlace: Bakchias, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

provenance.p: Purchased in Berlin by Lund University Library in 1933, from prof. Carl Schmidt; Isabella Andorlini "Scavi e acquisti di papiri negli anni '30: il caso dei PLund" in Comunicazioni, Firenze 1995, Istituto papirologico G. Vitelli, p. 45-50

div.ab: (From) Orsenouphis, priest of the great great god Soknobraisis of the village Bakchias, meris of Herakleides. List of priests and inventory of the temple for the current year, the twelfth. Among the things in the temple are a wooden gilded shrine of Soknobraisis and a gilded shrine of Pnepheros, fifteen trumpet-shaped bronze lampstands, one bronze censer, one bronze vessel, ten bronze cups, one bronze trumpet, two wooden pipes with seven bronze bands each, two gilded wooden plates, one bronze vessel(?). ...the priests, one by one ..., Sisois (?) (son of Orsenouphis and 34 years old?)

listBibl.bibl: P.Bacch. 4 SB VI 9336 P.Lund. III 5 BL III, 105 (line 13); BL IV, 48 (lines 15, 16); TM 14154; Wilcken, U., Archiv fír Papyrusforschung 13 (1939) p. 233; Hombert, M., Chronique d'–gypt 14, 1939, p. 400-401; Schmidt, K. F. W., Philologische Wochenschrift (Jahrgang) 60 (No 45/48), 1940, c. 608-611; van Groningen, B. A., Museum, Maandblad voor Philologie en Geschiedenis, 47, 1940, c. 168
